title: How to Marinate Rabbit in Kriek

steps.headline: Rasp the carrots and blend the bacon in a kitchen aid.
Melt a big chunk of butter in a Dutch oven, season the rabbit and roast the pieces until they are brown and lay them separately for a while.
Bake the bacon, slice the onions and add.
When the onions are brown, add the rabbit and liver.
Add the rasped carrots and pour the red vinegar over it, add a bay leaf with the garlic and submerge everything with the Kriek.
Add the brown sugar and let it simmer on a low fire for about an hour.
steps.description: If the juice is cooking out add more Kriek to it.

steps.headline: Take a different skillet and melt a chunk of butter.
Add the potatoes with the skin still on and layer them next to each other, put the lid on until they are done.
steps.description: After ten minutes turn them around.

steps.headline: Remove the liver after the rabbit is ready, there is no need to thicken the sauce.
Serve the rabbit with the potatoes and the fresh chopped parsley.

text: Rasp the carrots and blend the bacon in a kitchen aid.  Melt a big chunk of butter in a Dutch oven, season the rabbit and roast the pieces until they are brown and lay them separately for a while.  Bake the bacon, slice the onions and add.  When the onions are brown, add the rabbit and liver.  Add the rasped carrots and pour the red vinegar over it, add a bay leaf with the garlic and submerge everything with the Kriek.  Add the brown sugar and let it simmer on a low fire for about an hour. If the juice is cooking out add more Kriek to it. Take a different skillet and melt a chunk of butter.  Add the potatoes with the skin still on and layer them next to each other, put the lid on until they are done. After ten minutes turn them around. Remove the liver after the rabbit is ready, there is no need to thicken the sauce.  Serve the rabbit with the potatoes and the fresh chopped parsley.
